byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jonah Engel Bromwich, C. J. Chivers, Sandra E. Garcia, Christopher Mele, Sarah Maslin Nir and Nate Schweber.
byline.original: By MARC SANTORA, WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM, AL BAKER and ADAM GOLDMAN

abstract: Federal Bureau of Investigation agents stop car on Belt Parkway near Verrazano-Narrows Bridge and take five people into custody in connection with bombing in Chelsea neighborhood of Manhattan; bombs found around neighborhood offer trove of clues into attack; officials, who are working to determine motive, are increasingly focused on possibility that episode is connected to pipe bombs found in Elizabeth, NJ.
lead_paragraph: The people were taken to an F.B.I. office in Manhattan, and an official said they may have been heading to the airport. Tensions in the region increased when the authorities said pipe bombs were found in Elizabeth, N.J.
snippet: The people were taken to an F.B.I. office in Manhattan, and an official said they may have been heading to the airport. Tensions in the region increased when the authorities said pipe bombs were found in Elizabeth, N.J....

headline.main: Manhattan Bombs Provide Trove of Clues; F.B.I. Questions 5 People
headline.print_headline: Bombs Built for Carnage  Provide a Trove of Clues
